text: Olivier Jean Blanchard (; born December 27, 1948) is a French economist. He worked for the Peterson Institute for International Economics. He was the chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, from September 1, 2008 to October 2015."IMF Economic Counsellor and Director of Research Olivier Blanchard To Retire from the Fund" (International Monetary Fund; May 14, 2015). He is also Robert M. Solow Professor of Economics emeritus at MIT. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:French academics Category:French economists Category:People from Amiens
title: Olivier Blanchard
